intro: Leptorhabdos parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered leptorhabdos, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
